definition: to a great depth, exhibiting great cunning usually with secrecy, literary term for an ocean
details:
adverb
- to a great depth
= synonyms: deeply
- to a great distance
= example: to a great distance
- to an advanced time
= example: to an advanced time
= synonyms: late
adjective
- exhibiting great cunning usually with secrecy
= example: exhibiting great cunning usually with secrecy
- strong
= synonyms: rich
- very distant in time or space
= example: very distant in time or space
- having great spatial extension or penetration downward or inward from an outer surface or backward or laterally or outward from a center
- relatively deep or strong
= example: relatively deep or strong
- difficult to penetrate
= synonyms: abstruse, recondite
- of an obscure nature
= synonyms: cryptic, cryptical, mysterious, inscrutable, mystifying
- with head or back bent low
= example: with head or back bent low
- having or denoting a low vocal or instrumental range
= example: having or denoting a low vocal or instrumental range
= synonyms: bass
- large in quantity or size
= example: large in quantity or size
- extreme
= example: extreme
= synonyms: all-fired
- very intense darkness
= example: very intense darkness
= synonyms: thick
- marked by depth of thinking
= example: marked by depth of thinking
- relatively thick from top to bottom
= example: relatively thick from top to bottom
- extending relatively far inward
= example: extending relatively far inward
noun
- literary term for an ocean
= example: literary term for an ocean
- a long steep-sided depression in the ocean floor
= synonyms: trench, oceanic abyss
- the central and most intense or profound part
= example: the central and most intense or profound part
